Sentencas: The conductivity of spinel coating on metallic interconnects is of great significance for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: Here, we develop a thorough theoretical study on the point defect diffusion based on first-principles calculations that reveals the conduction mechanism of a CoMn2O4 spinel crystal.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: Defect models that use three types of va-cancies and five types of interstitial atoms of Co, Mn, and O, are proposed and optimized.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: The energy barriers for diffusion of the vacancies, interstitial atoms and cascade reactions are calculated and analyzed.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: The diffusion pathways across the entire crystal are established.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: From the calculation of the corresponding diffusion co-efficients, it is found that the mobility of O atomic defect is higher than that of Co defect, and that of the Mn defect is the lowest.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: Our results reveal that the conductivity of a CoMn2O4 crystal may mainly depend on diffusion of interstitial O atoms and O vacancies.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: Therefore, our study suggests that the conductivity of CoMn2O4 spinel crystal may be improved by increasing the concentration of O atomic defects.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal

Sentencas: The obtained activation energies and diffusion coefficients can provide theoretical support to the related experiments.
Titulo: First-principles study of point defect diffusion in CoMn2O4 crystal
